derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense 'haphazard, not selective'): from in- 'not' + Latin discriminatus, past participle of discriminare (see discriminate)

entry.tran: 不加区别的;不加选择的
entry.def: If you describe an action as indiscriminate, you are critical of it because it does not involve any careful thought or choice.

example.ex: The indiscriminate use of fertilisers is damaging to the environment.

example.tran: 对难民不分青红皂白的杀戮

means.word_mean: 1. failing to make or recognize distinctions

sentences.sentence: "an indiscriminate mixture of colors and styles"
